The search didn't return any results specifically about a project called **"leanblueprint"** with Python sidebar toggle chapters and JavaScript. Instead, the results cover general sidebar toggle implementations across various frameworks. Here's a summary of the most relevant findings:

---

### Relevant Results

1. **mkdocs-toggle-sidebar-plugin (PyPI)**
   - This package allows you to toggle the left (navigation) and right (table of contents) sidebars on a couple of MkDocs themes. The settings are stored using the localStorage object, so that it will persist between pages.
   - When you set the `toggle_button` option to navigation, toc or all, it will add a button that looks like a hamburger menu (three horizontal bars) on a theme-dependent location. It is usually in the nav or the top bar. Clicking the button will toggle the navigation, table of contents, or both.

2. **PyData Sphinx Theme – Navigation & Collapsing Sidebars**
   - By default, this theme enables expand/collapse of subsections in the left sidebar navigation (without actually navigating to the page itself), extending up to 4 levels deep. By default, this level is 1, and only top-level pages are shown, with drop-boxes to reveal their children.
   - In some Sphinx sites, the top-level toctree groupings make up "parts" in the documentation, with each page beneath making up a "chapter".
   - If your toctree elements have captions assigned to them (with `:caption:`), you may collapse navigation items so that only the caption is visible. Clicking on the caption will display the items below. To enable this behavior, set the `show_nav_level` value to 0.

3. **Streamlit – Toggle Sidebar from Python**
   - There is a discussion about hiding/showing (toggling) the sidebar from Python, beyond just the `initial_sidebar_state` in `set_page_config`.

4. **CodePen – Sidebar with Toggle Button in JavaScript**
   - A pure JavaScript/CSS implementation using class toggling to show/hide a sidebar element.

---

1→/-

     5→import Lean
     6→import Verso.Output.Html

    10→import Runway.Render
    11→import Runway.DepGraph
    12→import Runway.Macros
    13→import Runway.AvailableDocuments
    14→
    15→/-!
    16→# Blueprint Theme System
    17→
    18→Provides theming support for Blueprint HTML rendering, following
    19→VersoBlog's Theme pattern. Themes control the overall appearance
    20→and layout of the generated site.
    21→
    22→## Architecture
    23→
    24→A Theme consists of:
    25→- Primary template: wraps entire page content (html, head, body)
    26→- Node template: renders individual blueprint nodes
    27→- Index template: renders the site overview/landing page
    28→- CSS and JS files to include
    29→
    30→Themes can be customized or replaced entirely.
    31→-/
    32→
    33→namespace Runway
    34→
    35→open Lean (Name)
    36→open Verso.Output Html
    37→
    38→/-! ## Theme Structure -/
    39→
    40→/-- A template function that transforms content to HTML -/
    41→def Template := Html → RenderM Html
    42→
    43→/-- A template for rendering nodes -/
    44→def NodeTemplate := NodeInfo → RenderM Html
    45→
    46→/-- A template for rendering the site index -/
    47→def IndexTemplate := BlueprintSite → RenderM Html
    48→
    49→/-- Theme specification for Blueprint sites -/
    50→structure Theme where
    51→  /-- Theme name for identification -/
    52→  name : String
    53→  /-- Primary template wrapping the entire page -/
    54→  primaryTemplate : Template
    55→  /-- Template for rendering individual nodes -/
    56→  nodeTemplate : NodeTemplate
    57→  /-- Template for rendering the index page -/
    58→  indexTemplate : IndexTemplate
    59→  /-- CSS files to include (filename, content) -/
    60→  cssFiles : Array (String × String) := #[]
    61→  /-- JS files to include (filename, content, inHead) -/
    62→  jsFiles : Array (String × String × Bool) := #[]
    63→
    64→/-! ## Default Theme -/
    65→
    66→namespace DefaultTheme
    67→
    68→/-- Check if current page is a blueprint page (TeX or Verso) -/
    69→def isBlueprintPage (currentSlug : Option String) (chapters : Array ChapterInfo) : Bool :=
    70→  -- Dashboard (none) is NOT a blueprint page - it shouldn't show the chapter panel
    71→  -- Chapter pages are blueprint pages
    72→  -- Blueprint [TeX] (slug "") and Blueprint [Verso] are blueprint pages
    73→  match currentSlug with
    74→  | none => false  -- Dashboard - no chapter panel
    75→  | some "dep_graph" => false
    76→  | some "paper_tex" => false
    77→  | some "pdf_tex" => false
    78→  | some "paper_verso" => false
    79→  | some "pdf_verso" => false
    80→  | some slug =>
    81→    -- Check if it's a chapter page
    82→    chapters.any (·.slug == slug) || slug == "" || slug == "blueprint_verso"
    83→
    84→/-- Render chapter panel (shown to the right of sidebar for blueprint pages) -/
    85→def renderChapterPanel (chapters : Array ChapterInfo) (currentSlug : Option String) (toRoot : String) : Html :=
    86→  if chapters.isEmpty then Html.empty
    87→  else
    88→    let chapterItems := chapters.map fun chap =>
    89→      let chapterLabel := if chap.isAppendix
    90→        then s!"Appendix: {chap.title}"
    91→        else s!"Ch {chap.number}: {chap.title}"
    92→      let isActive := currentSlug == some chap.slug
    93→      let cls := if isActive then "chapter-panel-item active" else "chapter-panel-item"
    94→      .tag "li" #[] (
    95→        .tag "a" #[("href", s!"{toRoot}{chap.slug}.html"), ("class", cls)] (Html.text true chapterLabel)
    96→      )
    97→
    98→    .tag "nav" #[("class", "chapter-panel")] (
    99→      .tag "div" #[("class", "chapter-panel-header")] (Html.text true "Chapters") ++
   100→      .tag "ul" #[("class", "chapter-panel-list")] (.seq chapterItems)
   101→    )
   102→
   103→/-- Render sidebar navigation (static, no dropdowns) -/
   104→def renderSidebar (chapters : Array ChapterInfo) (currentSlug : Option String) (toRoot : String) (config : Config) (availDocs : AvailableDocuments := {}) : Html :=
   105→  -- Breathing room spacer
   106→  let topSpacer := .tag "li" #[("class", "sidebar-top-spacer")] Html.empty

input_full.prompt:
I need to design an implementation plan for GitHub issue #104: "Sidebar overhaul: reduce width, inline chapter toggles, remove second sidebar".

## Current Architecture

### Files involved:

1. **blueprint.css** (`toolchain/dress-blueprint-action/assets/blueprint.css`)
   - Line 175: Sidebar width `max-width: 25ch`
   - Line 178: Sidebar item font-size `0.875rem`
   - Lines 1389-1401: `.wrapper.with-chapter-panel` layout styles

2. **common.css** (`toolchain/dress-blueprint-action/assets/common.css`)
   - Lines 912-1039: Sidebar item styles (active, disabled, doc links, external links, etc.)
   - Lines 1041-1135: Chapter panel styles (`.chapter-panel`, `.chapter-panel-item`, etc.)

3. **Theme.lean** (`toolchain/Runway/Runway/Theme.lean`)
   - Lines 68-83: `isBlueprintPage` function
   - Lines 84-101: `renderChapterPanel` function (renders the separate chapter panel)
   - Lines 103-200: `renderSidebar` function (main sidebar nav)
   - Lines 298-380: `primaryTemplateWithSidebar` (assembles sidebar + chapter panel + content)

4. **plastex.js** (`toolchain/dress-blueprint-action/assets/plastex.js`)
   - Lines 57-62: Mobile menu toggle (toggles both nav.toc and nav.chapter-panel)

### Current Behavior
- Sidebar nav (`nav.toc`) at `25ch` max-width, font-size `0.875rem`
- Separate chapter panel (`.chapter-panel`) at `200px` fixed width, appears between sidebar and content on blueprint pages only
- Active state is build-time: Lean sets `sidebar-item active` class based on `currentSlug`
- `isBlueprintPage` determines if the chapter panel renders
- Wrapper gets `with-chapter-panel` class for CSS layout

## Requirements

1. **Reduce sidebar width by 30%**: 25ch → ~17.5ch
2. **Slightly larger text**: Bump from 0.875rem
3. **Remove the second sidebar** (chapter panel): Kill `.chapter-panel` entirely
4. **Inline chapters under Blueprint**: Chapters become collapsible sub-items in the main sidebar
5. **Highlight-coupled toggling**: 
   - "Blueprint" becomes a toggle (not direct navigation link)
   - On blueprint pages: Blueprint is active → chapters shown by default
   - On other pages: chapters hidden by default
   - Clicking "Blueprint" text toggles chapter list visibility
   - Small arrow indicator for expanded/collapsed state
6. **Verso blueprint and paper**: Use their built-in tooling (keep as-is)
7. **Affects all projects** (SBSTest, GCR, PNT) naturally via shared assets/templates

## Design the plan

Design a concrete implementation plan with:
- Wave structure (which files change together)
- Specific changes per file
- CSS class names for new elements
- JS toggle implementation
- What to remove vs what to add
- Gates and validation approach

Keep it concise and focused. This touches 2 repos:
- `dress-blueprint-action` (CSS/JS assets)
- `Runway` (Lean template)

Both are submodules. Changes to CSS/JS are in dress-blueprint-action. Template changes are in Runway.

The toggle approach: "Blueprint" in the sidebar becomes a clickable toggle header (not a navigation link). Under it, chapter links appear as sub-items. A chevron/arrow indicates expanded/collapsed. On page load, JS checks if the current page is a blueprint page and expands if so. Simple click handler toggles visibility.

# Sidebar Overhaul - Issue #104 ## Scope Remove standalone chapter panel, inline chapters under "Blueprint" toggle in sidebar, reduce width, bump font size. Touches 2 submodule repos: `dress-blueprint-action` (CSS/JS) and `Runway` (Lean template). --- ## Wave 1: Template Changes (Runway/Theme.lean) **File:** `toolchain/Runway/Runway/Theme.lean` ### 1a. Remove `renderChapterPanel` (lines 84-101) Delete entirely -- no longer needed. ### 1b. Modify `renderSidebar` (lines 103-200) Replace the TeX Blueprint `mkDocItem` call (line 156) with a new inline toggle structure: ```html
  • ▸ Blueprint
    • Ch 1: Title
      • ...
    • ``` New Lean helper `renderBlueprintToggle` takes `chapters`, `currentSlug`, `toRoot`, `available`. When `available == false`, renders disabled span (no toggle, no chapters). ### 1c. Modify `primaryTemplateWithSidebar` (lines 298-380) - Remove `showChapterPanel` / `chapterPanel` computation (lines 310-313) - Remove conditional `wrapperClass` (line 328) -- always `"wrapper"` - Remove `chapterPanel` from template output (line 368) ### 1d. Add `data-blueprint-page` attribute to `` Use existing `isBlueprintPage` to set `data-blueprint-page="true"` on body tag. Gives JS the signal to auto-expand chapters. --- ## Wave 2: CSS Changes (dress-blueprint-action) ### blueprint.css **2a. Reduce sidebar width** (line 175): `25ch` -> `17.5ch` **2b. Bump font-size** (line 178): `0.875rem` -> `0.9375rem` **2c. Remove `.wrapper.with-chapter-panel` styles** (lines 1389-1401) ### common.css **2d. Remove chapter panel section** (lines 1041-1135) -- entire "Section 11" **2e. Remove chapter panel CSS variables** (light ~line 114, dark ~line 321) **2f. Add inline chapter styles** (in section 10): - `.sidebar-blueprint-group` -- flex column container - `.sidebar-blueprint-toggle` -- clickable, cursor pointer - `.sidebar-chevron` -- rotate 90deg when `.expanded` - `.sidebar-chapter-list` -- `max-height: 0` -> `max-height: 50vh` transition - `.sidebar-chapter-item` -- indented, smaller font, active highlight --- ## Wave 3: JavaScript (plastex.js) **3a. Remove** `$("nav.chapter-panel").toggle()` from mobile toggle (line 61) **3b. Add chapter toggle:** ```js (function() { var $group = $('.sidebar-blueprint-group'); if (!$group.length) return; var $toggle = $group.find('.sidebar-blueprint-toggle'); if (document.body.hasAttribute('data-blueprint-page')) { $group.addClass('expanded'); } $toggle.on('click', function() { $group.toggleClass('expanded'); }); })(); ``` --- ## Execution Single `sbs-developer` agent, sequential waves (tight coupling between template and CSS/JS). Commit order: dress-blueprint-action first, Runway second, parent repo pointer update last. --- ## Gates ```yaml gates: tests: all_pass test_tier: evergreen quality: T5: ">= 0.8" T6: ">= 0.9" regression: ">= 0" validators: - visual: [dashboard, chapter, dep_graph] - timing: true ``` ## Validation Steps 1. Build SBS-Test: `python ../../dev/scripts/build.py` 2. Capture: `python3 -m sbs capture --project SBSTest --interactive` 3. Visual check: no chapter panel column, narrower sidebar, chapters inline under Blueprint 4. Tests: `pytest sbs/tests/pytest -m evergreen --tb=short` 5. Build GCR to confirm multi-project (has real chapters)
